intro: Besleria chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
